intro: Alsodeia comosa, commonly known as the hairy alsike, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a hairy appearance. Alsodeia comosa is typically found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
